title: SpaceX a bastion of independent US, European spaceflight amid Russian threats
summary: Russia has invaded Ukraine without provocation, triggering a series of diplomatic responses – sanctions in particular – that recently culminated in the...

title: GOES-T nears launch as NASA plans studies of next-generation weather satellite
summary: The latest in a series of geostationary weather satellites is ready for launch as NASA takes the next step in plans for a next generation of such spacecraft.

title: China launches national record 22 satellites on Long March 8 commercial rideshare
summary: China’s second Long March 8 rocket launched late Saturday carrying a domestic record 22 satellites for a range of commercial Chinese space companies.

title: Commercial spy satellites put Russia’s Ukraine invasion in the public eye
summary: Images collected by commercial satellites have chronicled the buildup of Russian forces on Ukraine’s borders and the ongoing invasion, providing intelligence previously only available from government sources — and seldom released to the public.

title: Russia suspends Soyuz launch operations in French Guiana
summary: Blaming European sanctions enacted after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the Russian space agency said Saturday it is recalling dozens of engineers and technicians from French Guiana and suspending Soyuz rocket operations there, grounding a pair of European navigation satellites previously set for launch in early April.

title: Xplore banks $16.2 million for space-as-a-service
summary: Space-as-a-service startup Xplore has brought in $16.2 million to date including venture capital funding and contracts.

title: Russia halts Soyuz launches from French Guiana
summary: Roscosmos announced Feb. 26 that it is halting cooperation with Europe on Soyuz launches from French Guiana and withdrawing its personnel from the launch site in response to European sanctions for Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Russia pulls out of European spaceport, abandoning a planned launch
summary: "We will take all relevant decisions in response to this decision."

title: Sierra Space to study Dream Chaser landings in Japan
summary: Sierra Space has signed an agreement to study future landings of its Dream Chaser vehicle at a Japanese airport.

title: SpaceX makes its case for space sustainability with latest Starlink launch
summary: SpaceX launched another set of Starlink satellites Feb. 25 as the company argues its satellite constellation is consistent with the safe and sustainable use of low Earth orbit.
